TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AVCaptureDevice extends Foundation.NSObject

Docs.summary: Support for accessing the audio and video capture hardware for AVCaptureSession.

remarks.para: Once a capture session has begun, application developers must bracket configuration changes with calls to and .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Foundation.NSObjectFlag t) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructor to call on derived classes to skip initialization and merely allocate the object.

remarks.para: This constructor should be called by derived classes when they completely construct the object in managed code and merely want the runtime to allocate and initialize the NSObject. This is required to implement the two-step initialization process that Objective-C uses, the first step is to perform the object allocation, the second step is to initialize the object. When developers invoke the constructor that takes the NSObjectFlag.Empty they take advantage of a direct path that goes all the way up to NSObject to merely allocate the object's memory and bind the Objective-C and C# objects together. The actual initialization of the object is up to the developer.

This constructor is typically used by the binding generator to allocate the object, but prevent the actual initialization to take place. Once the allocation has taken place, the constructor has to initialize the object. With constructors generated by the binding generator this means that it manually invokes one of the "init" methods to initialize the object.
It is the developer's responsibility to completely initialize the object if they chain up using the NSObjectFlag.Empty path.

In general, if the developer's constructor invokes the NSObjectFlag.Empty base implementation, then it should be calling an Objective-C init method. If this is not the case, developers should instead chain to the proper constructor in their class.

The argument value is ignored and merely ensures that the only code that is executed is the construction phase is the basic NSObject allocation and runtime type registration. Typically the chaining would look like this:

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of unmanaged objects; Called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a pointer to an unmanaged Objective-C object. Developers should not invoke this method directly, instead they should call the GetNSObject method as it will prevent two instances of a managed object to point to the same native object.

Docs.summary: Whether the system should automatically enable "boost mode" (ISO 3200) in low light.

remarks.para: The default ISO equivalence for the iPhone 5 is 800. The "boost mode" increases sensitivity to ISO 3200, at the cost of increased sensor noise.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelVideoZoomRamp() cil managed

Docs.summary: Smoothly cancels an in-progress video zoom.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to calling with a rate of 0. The zoom does not end immediately, but stops smoothly.

Docs.summary: The handle for this class.
Docs.value: The pointer to the Objective-C class.
Docs.remarks: Each Xamarin.iOS class mirrors an unmanaged Objective-C class. This value contains the pointer to the Objective-C class, it is similar to calling objc_getClass with the object name.

Docs.summary: Whether the is available for use.

remarks.para: Although this value may change from to when a device is disconnected, it will not change from to when the device is reconnected. In that situation, the physical device will be represented by a different instance of .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetExposureTargetBias (float bias, Action<CoreMedia.CMTime> completionHandler);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetExposureTargetBias(float32 bias, class System.Action`1<valuetype CoreMedia.CMTime> completionHandler) cil managed

Docs.param: Bias to apply to the exposure target. You can pass if you do not want to specify a value, and instead want to use the current value.

param.name: completionHandler
param.para: This method is invoked when the bias has been set.
The method receives a parameter with the device clock timestamp of the first sample buffer that received the new bias setting.
If you must compare the time stamp with the buffers delivered by you must convert the time to the master clock.

Docs.summary: Sets the exposure target bias (measured in units).
Docs.remarks: You must invoke the method before invoking this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<valuetype CoreMedia.CMTime> SetExposureTargetBiasAsync(float32 bias) cil managed

Docs.param: Bias to apply to the exposure target. You can pass if you do not want to specify a value, and instead want to use the current value.
Docs.summary: Sets the exposure target bias (measured in units).

returns.para: A task that represents the asynchronous SetExposureTargetBias operation. The value of the TResult parameter is of type System.Action<CoreMedia.CMTime>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetFocusModeLocked (float lensPosition, Action<CoreMedia.CMTime> completionHandler);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetFocusModeLocked(float32 lensPosition, class System.Action`1<valuetype CoreMedia.CMTime> completionHandler) cil managed

param.name: lensPosition
param.para: Sets the lens position, must be a value between 0.0 and 1.0. The zero value representing the shortest position that the camera can focus and one representing the furthest position that it can focus.

If you do not want to set the lens position, pass the
value.

param.name: completionHandler
param.para: Method to invoke when the camera has been changed to the specified lens position, the parameter of the callback is the time at which the change took place.

Docs.summary: Locks the lens position at the specified position.
Docs.remarks: You must invoke the method before invoking this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<valuetype CoreMedia.CMTime> SetFocusModeLockedAsync(float32 lensPosition) cil managed

Docs.param:
Sets the lens position, must be a value between 0.0 and 1.0. The zero value representing the shortest position that the camera can focus and one representing the furthest position that it can focus. If you do not want to set the lens position, pass the
value.
Docs.summary: Locks the lens position at the specified position.

returns.para: A task that represents the asynchronous SetFocusModeLocked operation. The value of the TResult parameter is of type System.Action<CoreMedia.CMTime>.

Notification constant for SubjectAreaDidChange
Docs.value: NSString constant, should be used as a token to NSNotificationCenter.

remarks.para: This constant can be used with the to register a listener for this notification. This is an NSString instead of a string, because these values can be used as tokens in some native libraries instead of being used purely for their actual string content. The 'notification' parameter to the callback contains extra information that is specific to the notification type.
If you want to subscribe to this notification, you can use the convenience . method which offers strongly typed access to the parameters of the notification.
The following example shows how to use the strongly typed Notifications class, to take the guesswork out of the available properties in the notification:
The following example shows how to use the notification with the DefaultCenter API:

Docs.summary: Indicates if the device is currently streaming HDR video.

remarks.para: Setting this property requires the IsVideoHdrSupported to be , otherwise you will get an exception.
Setting the property will change this to .
This property can only be set if you first set to .
In constrat, setting the will set this property to if the session preset is a good match for HDR video.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual nfloat VideoZoomFactor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: The current zoom of the video capture.
Docs.value: A value of 1.0 is full-frame (fully zoomed out).

remarks.para: This value is a reciprocal of the amount of zoom. For instance, a value of 2.0 indicates a zoom that includes half the field of view.
